page.title: 09Farming Dairy
page.content: Although farming is considered the main industry in this area, it is not undertaken on a large scale. Most of the farms are over coal measures and, in most cases, coal has been worked there as on the only dairy farm in the area. This Farm, Wernddu Isaf, which has 20 British Freisian cows produces milk which is sold to the Milk Marketing Board who, in turn sell it to C.W.S. Ltd., Llangadog. It is collected by bulk road tanker daily and taken to Llangadog for the manufacture of butter or creamed rice puddings. The access to the farm is not suitable for road tankers so a mobile tank is brought to the collection point daily. There is an additional enterprise, a riding school. The other exception is a poultry farm (Llanllechau) where egg production is the main enterprise.
